page.description: The !$ operator determines whether the character expression on the left of the operator is not contained anywhere within the character expression on the right. Operations involving the !$ operator return a logical result (i.e., TRUE or FALSE). The string comparison is not case sensitive. See Also Character Search Functions
page.syntax: Result as L = Find_String as C !$ Search_String as C

argument.name: Find_String
argument.description: The character string that you are looking for.

section.title: Example:
section.example: dim Company as C = "The Computer Store" ? "Computer" !$ Company = .F. ? "computer" !$ Company = .F. "Alpha" !$ Company = .T.
